title: Gemma Collins ends up flat on her face as she recreates infamous Dancing On Ice fall
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Gemma Collins fell flat on her face as she recreated her infamous Dancing On Ice fall.

During an appearance on Celebrity Juice , the TOWIE star was asked to show off her "best move" from the ITV contest.

After host Keith Lemon quizzed panelist Maura Higgins about signing up for the show, the GC was asked to pass on some advice to the Love Island babe.

And never one to miss an opportunity to entertain, Gemma hopped to her feet to do it.

Maura laughed as Gemma asked her: "Do you really want tips from me?"

After taking to the floor, Gemma said: "What do you want me to do, Keith?"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Gemma obliged by miming skating across the studio floor and flailing her arms in the air as she pretended to get her toe pick caught in the ice and stumble forward, falling onto a crash mat that had been laid out to catch her.

The move left the audience in fits of laughter.

It will be seen on tonight's episode of Celebrity Juice, when Gemma and Maura are joined on the panel by Silent Witness star Emilia Fox, presenter and actress Denise Van Outen and team captains Holly Willoughby and Mel B.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Earlier this year, Gemma caused much controversy as she took part in Dancing On Ice.

She regularly clashed with judge Jason Gardiner and famously fell on her face and skidded across the ice while performing live with partner Matt Evers.

Gemma said on a previous episode of Celebrity Juice, alongside then-boyfriend James 'Arg' Argent, that the fall had ruined her sex life.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Matt Frost/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

She said her knees hurt so much that she could no longer kneel down.

* Celebrity Juice airs Thursdays at 10pm on ITV2

description: The TOWIE star was asked to recreate her best known Dancing On Ice move to give new contestant Maura Higgins some tips
